title: As Omicron Takes Over in the U.S., More Curbs World-Wide
sub_head: Fast-spreading variant prompts caution over travel, events
body:
New travel restrictions and other steps to curb the spread of the Omicron variant were put in place world-wide as further evidence emerged of just how rapidly the new strain spreads.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Monday that Omicron had overtaken the Delta variant of the coronavirus in the U.S., accounting for an estimated 73% of infections for the week ending Dec. 18. Updated CDC data for a week earlier showed Omicron had caused about 13% of infections.
